Indices and tables¶

  • Index

CAR MODULE¶

This module creates a Car store that gets items form a Car Factory.

class cars.BMW(**arg)¶
__init__(**arg)¶

Creates a BMW Class. Inherits CAR

Parameters

  • arg (dict) – Contains the information about a BMW car.

  • type (str) – The type of the car. Should be part of arg. Key is «type».

  • doors (int) – The doors that the car has. Should be part of arg. Key is «doors».

  • fuel (Fuel) – The fuel that the car needs. Should be part of arg. Key is «fuel».

class cars.Car¶

A single Car Class All Car types inherit from it.

__init__()¶

This is the Car constructor.

Parameters

self (Car) – The instance of this object.

__str__()¶

Prnts: This car is a {s.model}: {s.type}, Wow! The car has {s.doors} doors and {s.seets} seets

Returns

A custom string showing off the make model and capacity of the current car.

print_model()¶

Prints the model of the current car using self.model and self.type.

Parameters

self (Car) – The instance of this object.

Returns

Nothing

Return type

None

print_space()¶

Prints the space in the current car.

Parameters

self (Car) – The instance of this object.

Returns

Nothing

Return type

None

class cars.CarStore(**kwargs)¶

The car store

__init__(**kwargs)¶

Initialize self. See help(type(self)) for accurate signature.

__str__()¶

Return str(self).

show_car(car=None)¶

Shows a car and what fuel it uses. If car is not defined gets one from the factory.

Parameters

car (Car) – A car to be displayed. Default: None

Returns

Nothing

Return type

None

class cars.Fuel(**arg)¶

The Fuel of a Car.

__init__(**arg)¶

The Fuel of a Car.

Parameters

  • arg (dict) – The information about the Fuel

  • liters (int) – How many liters of fuel needed.

  • type (str) – What type of fuel needed.

__str__()¶

Prints: It uses {s.liters}L of {s.type}¢.

Returns

A Custom string showing what fuel it is,
